messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Censorship and unschooling cannotexisttogether!
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/6/03 6:42:08 PM, leschke@shaw.ca writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/6/03 6:42:08 PM, leschke@... writes:

<< What about someone who wanted to get everyone on the list to buy
a Chevy? Maybe someone wants to convince everyone in the world to try
heroin? >>

Or buy formal phonics methods?
Or a homeschooling curriculum they designed themselves?

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Censorship and unschooling cannotexisttogether!
messages.msgSnippet: ... too. And if it didn t?  If they just came here to try to get people to join their religion?  What about someone who wanted to get everyone on the list to
messages.messageBody:
> Yes, I do believe that if individuals were to feel that religious
> proselytizing related to their unschooling, then you should allow that
too.

And if it didn't? If they just came here to try to get people to join their
religion? What about someone who wanted to get everyone on the list to buy
a Chevy? Maybe someone wants to convince everyone in the world to try
heroin? What if someone came here and started talking about how bad black
people or Jews or homosexuals are and how they should all be killed? Is
there a line you would draw anywhere?
Tia
